alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 12:03AM EDT until March 16 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River At Andover. * WHEN...From this morning to this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Floodwaters encroach on very lowest lying business parking lots off of Route 114 in Lawrence and North Andover that are adjacent to the Shawsheen River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 28.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.0 feet this morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.1 feet on 03/10/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1215 PM EDT.
